game:itemdesc-fishsauce: Umami! Add to sushi, stews, or au gratin for richer flavor.
itemdesc-breadcrumbs-*: Bread, but powdery. Great for thickening stews and soups.
itemdesc-acornbreadcrumbs-*: Nutty bread, but powdery. Great for thickening stews and soups.
itemdesc-acornbreadedmeatnugget-*-syrups: Sweet, crunchy meat! Has rich flavor.
itemdesc-acornbreadedfishnugget-syrups: Sweet, crunchy fish! Nutty and delicious!
itemdesc-hardtack-*-bake1: Tough crackers that keep for years.
itemdesc-hardtack-*-bake2: Twice-baked crackers that are completely flavorless.
itemdesc-hardtack-*-bake3: Thrice-baked crackers. A sharp hazard to yourself and others.
itemdesc-acornhardtack-*-bake1: Tough, earthy crackers that keep for years.
itemdesc-acornhardtack-*-bake2: Twice-baked crackers that are completely flavorless.
itemdesc-acornhardtack-*-bake3: Thrice-baked crackers. A sharp hazard to yourself and others.
expandedfoodsguide-text:
Expanded Foods: Chef's Cookbook
Getting started.

Documentation on this mod can be found here.
Updated versions can be found here.

Introduction
This mod adds a wide variety of uses for food that will make your cooking experience more in-depth. It also interacts with the mods Acorns, Primitive Survival, and Wild Farming for even more recipes, but this requires the Compatibility Library. All mods are strongly recommended when using this one, especially Wild Farming, since without it you cannot grow seaweed.
This mod includes the ability to make bushmeat meals, vinegar and salt. Delete those mods if you are using this one.

BASIC FOOD LIST

Boiled Eggs
Boiled eggs are already in the game, but inaccessible. This fixes that.
Vinegar
Can be made by sealing fresh berries in a barrel for 28 days. If sealed with vinegar as well, it takes a fraction of the time.
Salt
Seal 5 liters of water or 2 liters of brine in a barrel to make a bit of salt. Salt now heals 0.5-1 HP when used in food.
Dried Berries
Cook berries to preserve them. Dried berries can be added to any meal that accepts berries.
Vegetable Variants
Throw veggies or mushrooms onto a fire to boost its nutrition by 25% and reduce its shelf life by 50%. Great way to extend the life of veggies that are about to rot. Veggies and mushrooms can also be chopped to make them easier to eat.
Meat Variants
Hit some meat with a stone or hammer to produce a smashed version of that meat. Slice the tenderized meat up with a knife to make meat nuggets. This can be done with fish as well, and can be used in any meals that allow regular meat. You can also hang meat from a meat rack to dry age it, which needs to have the outside cut off before cooking.
Bread Crumbs
You can tear a loaf of bread up by hand or place it in a quern to make bread crumbs out of it. When used in meals, a single portion of bread crumbs gives as much nutrition as an entire loaf of bread.
Hardtack
By mixing salt into your typical bread recipe, you can make hardtack dough. Once cooked, it can be baked up to 3 more times to crush the moisture and flavor out of it and make it last longer.

COOKING POT MEALS

Au Gratin
In a cooking pot, mix 1 portion of milk and 1 slice of cheese. You can add vegetables, meat, eggs, bread crumbs, or more cheese to it. You can also add fish sauce, soy sauce, food oil, or lard before you start cooking.
Hot Pasta
In a cooking pot, mix 1 portion of pasta noodles and 1 portion of water or vegetable juice. You can add vegetables, meat, or eggs to it. You can also add fish sauce, soy sauce, food oil, or lard before you start cooking.
Rice & Beans
In a cooking pot, mix 1 portion of rice grain and 1 portion of soy beans. You can add vegetables, meat, or eggs to it. You can also add fish sauce, soy sauce, food oil, or lard before you start cooking.
Salad
Place a cooking pot in the mixing bowl's lower slot to get it ready, then mix together 2 portions of chopped vegetables or soybeans. You can add more veggies, fried veggies, boiled eggs, sausages, cooked meat, fried meat, fruit, dry fruit, cheese, and salt. You can also add fish sauce, soy sauce, food oil, or vinegar before mixing.
Yogurt Meal
Place a cooking pot in the mixing bowl's lower slot to get it ready, then put a portion of yogurt in it. You can add fruit and acorns to it. You can also add honey, tree syrup, fruit syrup, or gelatin before mixing.
Meat Stew
You can cook dumplings, bread crumbs, and dried berries. You can also add fish sauce, soy sauce, food oil, bone broth, wine, or lard before you start cooking.
Porridge
You can add in dried berries. You can also add maple syrup, birch syrup, fruit syrup, or lard before cooking.
Soup
You can use vegetable juice or bone broth instead of water. You may add dumplings and bread crumbs.
Veggie Stew
You may add dumplings and bread crumbs. You can also add fish sauce, soy sauce, food oil, or lard before cooking.
expandedfoodsguide2-text:
Cooking 102 - Advanced Cuisine
Cuisine for the discerning palate.

Documentation on this mod can be found here.
Updated versions can be found here.

Introduction
There are new items to help enrich your cooking experience. The mixing bowl, in particular, is very important.

ADVANCED COOKING BLOCKS

Bottles
Made from clay or glass, bottles are capable of holding liquids in the same manner as bowls and can be placed in the world or on shelves. Used for drizzling syrups or sauces on food via the mixing bowl, fermenting drinks, or simply drinking.
Meat Rack
Sausage or raw meat (but not fish) can be hung to dry on a meat rack. This process ages the meat and boosts its nutritional value. Raw aged meat needs to have the exterior cut away before cooking.
Mixing Bowl
Vital for creating many Expanded Foods. Can take 6 slots of food or liquid, then mix it together into a new item. Placing a pot into it allows you to make certain meals, such as salads. It can be mechanically powered by connecting an axle to the top or bottom of the block.
In addition to Expanded Foods, it can also make regular bread and hardtack dough.
The mixing bowl can be locked with CTRL + Right Click on the bowl. When locked, it will only accept the ingredients that were in it, and in those specific slots. It cannot automatically accept liquids.
Saucepan
Functions somewhat similarly to a bucket, but you can place it onto a firepit to cook the liquids inside, turning sap and juice into syrup. Fruit juices can be sealed in bottles or barrels to ferment into wine. In order to cook something in the saucepan, it must be placed into its slots. It is capable of turning some solids, such as bones, into liquids, and turning some liquids, such as water, into solids.
Screwpress
Place berries, seeds, rice grain, flax grain, soybeans, or vegetables in it and begin turning it to squeeze the liquid out of the base item. Takes roughly 4 hours.
Spile
Jam this into a tree and place a bucket or saucepan beneath it to collect sap from the tree during certain times of the year.
Fresh Resin can be collected in March through November.
Maple Sap can be collected in January, February, and March.
Birch Sap can be collected in April, May, and June.

EXPANDED FOOD LIST

All Expanded Foods are made in a mixing bowl, without adding a cooking pot.

Bread
1 portion of water OR milk OR pasteurized milk
1 bag of flour
1 portion of Food Oil or Lard (optional)
Yeast Starter (optional)
Berry Bread
1 ball of dough
Up to 5 fruits or dried fruits
Fruit, birch, maple, or honey gelatin (optional)
Once baked, add syrup or honey in the mixing bowl.
Soft Dough
1 portion of water OR milk OR pasteurized milk
1 bag of flour
1 egg
1 portion of Food Oil or Lard (optional)
Yeast Starter (optional)
Muffin
1 ball of soft dough
Up to 5 fruits or dried fruits
Fruit, birch, maple, or honey gelatin (optional)
Once baked, add syrup or honey in the mixing bowl.
Pasta Dough
1 bag of flour
1 egg
Once dough is formed, smash until flat and cut into noodles. Noodles can be used for cooking or boiled in a saucepan with water to eat by itself.
Breaded Food
1 egg OR 1 portion of honey OR food oil OR birch syrup OR maple syrup OR lard
1 handful of bread crumbs
1 bag of flour
1 handful of smashed meat or meat nuggets OR 1 vegetable/chopped handful of vegetables OR 1 handful of rice grain OR 1 slice of cheese.
Salt (optional)
When you have breaded your food, you can mix it with food oil or lard in the mixing bowl to deep fry it. Once fried, add honey, soy sauce, fish sauce, birch syrup, or maple syrup in the mixing bowl.
Dumplings
1 handful of Soft Dough
1 handful of meat nuggets OR chopped veggies OR soybeans (optional)
Salt (optional)
Can be used in stews and soups or cooked.
Pemmican
1 handful of animal fat OR lard
3 fruits
2 handfuls of meat nuggets
Salt (optional, replaces fruit)
Sausage
1 handful of animal fat OR lard
1 handful of meat nuggets
Cheddar or Blue cheese (optional)
Salt (optional)
Can be hung on a meat rack to age it before cooking. Usable in meat stews, au gratin, and rice & beans. Cooked sausage can be used in salads.
Sushi
1 sheet of dried seaweed
1 handful of rice grain
1 handful of chopped veggies, soybeans, or sauerkraut (optional)
Salt (optional)
Add honey, soy sauce, fish sauce, birch syrup, or maple syrup in the mixing bowl after creating the sushi roll.
Gelatin
In a saucepan, cook 2 portions of bone broth per 1 portion of bone to make liquid gelatin. Cook 1 portion of liquid gelatin, 1 bone, and 1 portion of water to make raw gelatin.
Raw Gelatin can be cooked with 1 portion of water to make plain gelatin, and 1 portion of juice or sauce can be added to make something more flavorful. If you are using syrup, then you will need 2 portions of water, each in a different slot of the saucepan.
Yogurt
In a saucepan, boil milk until it is pasteurized. Seal 1 portion of curdled milk and 4 handfuls of non-dried berries in a barrel for 24 hours to create yogurt starter.
Mix 1 portion of pasteurized milk with 4 portions of yogurt starter (a 1 liter: 1 liter ratio) in a mixing bowl to create fermented yogurt. Seal it in a barrel or bottle until it becomes plain yogurt. Mix with syrup or honey in a mixing bowl to make flavored yogurt.
expandedfoodsguide3-text:
Cooking 103 - Juicing
How do I make wine?

Documentation on this mod can be found here.
Updated versions can be found here.

Introduction
Squeezing the liquids out of something is a great way to expand your palate with new options. Here are all of the new liquids and how they can be made.

LIQUIDS LIST

Bone Broth
In meals: 25 Protein Satiety; 2 HP
Cook bones and water in a saucepan at a ratio of 1 bone per 2 portions of water.
Bread Starter
In bread: 25 Grain Satiety; 1 HP
Place dried berries and water in a barrel at a ratio of 6 handfuls of berries per liter of water. Seal for 4 days to make yeast water, then mix in a mixing bowl with 1 bag of flour and 1 handful of salt to make Wild Yeast Starter. Mix equal portions of yeast starter, yeast water, water, and bags of flour in the mixing bowl to create more yeast starter, allowing you to maintain it.
Food Oil
In meals or expanded foods: 100 Vegetable Satiety; 0.5 HP
Place 4 flax grains, rice grains, seeds, or soy beans into a screwpress and squeeze.
Fruit Juice
In meals: 180 Fruit Satiety; 1.5 HP
When drank: 120 Fruit Satiety; 1 HP
Place 4 berries into a screwpress and squeeze. Mix together all 5 kinds of berry juice in a mixing bowl to make mixed fruit juice, which is twice as effective at healing.
Fruit Wine
In meals or expanded foods: 225 Fruit Satiety; 2.25 HP
When drank: 150 Fruit Satiety; 1.5 HP
Place fruit juice in a barrel and seal. You can also bottle juice and let it ferment. Takes 2 weeks to ferment in a barrel or 6 weeks in a bottle. Wine stored in bottles last almost indefinitely.
Fruit Syrup
In meals or expanded foods: 270 Fruit Satiety; 3 HP
When drank: 180 Fruit Satiety; 2 HP
Place 1 liter of fruit juice in a saucepan and cook. For cactus syrup, cook 1 portion of water and 1 portion of saguaro fruit in a saucepan.
Lard
In meals or expanded foods: 250 Protein Satiety; 1 HP
Render 1 handful of fat in the saucepan.
Soy Sauce
In meals or expanded foods: 120 Protein Satiety; 2 HP
Soak soybeans in water, one liter of water per soybean portion. Once fully soaked, cook over a firepit and grind in a quern to make roasted soybean powder. Mix this powder with any grain in a mixing bowl or crafting grid to make soy sauce culture and soak in 1 liter of brine. Once the final soak is done, squeeze the soy slurry in a screwpress to retrieve soy sauce.
Tree Sap
When drank (birch sap only): 80 Fruit Satiety; 0.5 HP
Jam a spile into a birch/maple tree and place a bucket or saucepan underneath to collect... in certain months. Check Cooking 102 for details.
Tree Syrup
In meals or expanded foods: 120 Fruit Satiety; 1.5 HP
When drank: 80 Fruit Satiety; 1 HP
Cook 1 liter of tree sap in a saucepan.
Vegetable Juice
In meals: 180 Vegetable Satiety; 1.5 HP
When drank: 120 Vegetable Satiety; 1 HP
Place 4 vegetables into a screwpress and squeeze. Mix together all 6 kinds of vegetable juice in a mixing bowl to make mixed vegetable juice, which is twice as effective at healing.
Vinegar
In meals: 150 Fruit Satiety; 1 HP
Seal wine in a barrel or bottle to let it ferment, or place 3 berries and vinegar in a barrel to make it quickly. Takes 2 months in a bottle, 2 weeks in a barrel, and 1 week the quick way.
Fish Sauce (Primitive Survival Only)
In meals: 200 Protein Satiety; 0.5 HP
Seal fish in a barrel or press them in a screw press.
Bass/Bluegill require 1 portion of water per fish.
Arctic Char/Carp/Perch/Pike/Trout require 2 portions of water per fish.
Catfish require 3 portions of water per fish.
Fish fillets can be used, but require 3 fillets per portion of water.

These categories apply to the screw press as well, but you need at least 1 Catfish, 2 Arctic Char/Carp/Perch/Pike/Trout, 4 Bass/Bluegill, or 6 fish fillets.
expandedfoodsguide4-text:
Cooking 104 - Compatibility
These mods let me make WHAT?

Documentation on this mod can be found here.
Updated versions can be found here.

Introduction
Expanded Foods has new recipes utilizing aspects from the following mods: Acorns, Primitive Survival, and Wild Farming. This section details how to make these foods.

ACORNS

Handful of Acorns
Place dry leached acorns onto your crafting grid to split them into managable portions.
Acorns may be added to Meat Stews, Porridge, Vegetable Stews, Au Gratin, Rice & Beans, Salads, and Yogurt.
Vegetarian Trail Mix
3 handfuls of acorns
1 handful of soybeans
3 handfuls of dried fruit
1 slice of Cheddar or Blue cheese
There are 4 types of vegetarian trail mix - Beany, Cheesy, Fruity, and Nutty. To make that variant, add 1 or 2 more slots of any of the previous ingredients (ie. 3 handfuls of acorns into 1 or 2 more slots to make Nutty trail mix).
Gozinaki
1 handful of acorns
1 portion of honey
Salt (optional)
Mix ingredients in the mixing bowl, then cook. Once cooked, add honey, tree syrup, or fruit syrup to the mixing bowl and mix with gozinaki for a real treat.

All other Acorns additions simply involve adding Acorn Flour to a recipe that uses flour, or using acorn crumbs in place of regular crumbs.

PRIMITIVE SURVIVAL

Fish Sauce
See Cooking 103 for details.
Breaded Fish
1 egg OR 1 portion of honey OR food oil OR birch syrup OR maple syrup OR lard
1 handful of bread crumbs
1 smashed fish fillet or handful of fish nuggets
Salt (optional)
When you have breaded your food, you can mix it with food oil or lard in the mixing bowl to deep fry it. Once fried, add honey, soy sauce, fish sauce, birch syrup, or maple syrup in the mixing bowl.
Fish Dumplings
1 handful of Soft Dough
1 handful of fish nuggets
Salt (optional)
Can be used in stews and soups.
Fish Pemmican
1 handful of animal fat OR lard
3 fruits
2 handfuls of fish and/or meat nuggets
Salt (optional, replaces fruit)
Sushi
1 sheet of dried seaweed
1 handful of rice grain
1 handful of fish nuggets
1 handful of chopped veggies, soybeans, or sauerkraut (optional)
Salt (optional)
Drizzle a bottle of honey, soy sauce, fish sauce, birch syrup, or maple syrup on top.
Trail Mix
3 handfuls of acorns
4 sticks of jerky
3 handfuls of dried fruit
1 slice of Cheddar or Blue cheese
There are 4 types of trail mix - Cheesy, Fruity, Meaty, and Nutty. To make that variant, add 1 or 2 more slots of any of the previous ingredients (ie. 4 sticks of jerky into 1 or 2 more slots to make Meaty trail mix).

WILD FARMING

Herbs from Wild Farming can be added to most foods added by this mod, including all recipes.
Breaded Fish/Meat
Add bundle of herbs
Dumplings
Add bundle of herb
Fish/Meat Pemmican
Bundle of herbs replaces 1 fruit
Sausage
Add bundle of herbs
Sushi
Add bundle of herbs
Gozinaki
Add bundle of herbs
itemdesc-choppedvegetable-flyagaric: Maybe this wouldn't hurt if you cooked it?
itemdesc-choppedvegetable-*: Chopped away all the inedible bits!
Press fruit and seeds to get juice and o: Press fruit and seeds to get juice and oil.
itemdesc-berrybread-dough: Sweet berry dough. Handle with care.
itemdesc-berrybread-cooked: Sweet berry bread. Good for breakfast.
itemdesc-acornberrybread-dough: Sweet berry acorn dough. Handle with care.
itemdesc-acornberrybread-cooked: Sweet berry acorn bread. Good for breakfast.
itemdesc-acornberrybread-syrup: Overly sweet berry bread. Nutty and rich!
itemdesc-plaindoughball-ball: A soft, sticky variety of dough.
itemdesc-plaindoughball-bread: Soft and fluffy balls of bread.
itemdesc-acorndoughball-ball: A soft, sticky variety of nutty dough.
itemdesc-acorndoughball-bread: Soft and fluffy balls of bread. Nutty!
itemdesc-pemmican-cooked: Nice, warm pemmican with a meaty flavor.
itemdesc-pemmican-raw: An edible ball of pemmican that could use some heating up.
itemdesc-fishpemmican-cooked: Nice, warm pemmican with a fishy flavor.
itemdesc-fishpemmican-raw: An edible ball of fishy pemmican that could use some heating up.
itemdesc-muffin-cooked: A fluffy and delicious berry muffin!
itemdesc-muffin-dough: Soft berry dough. Handle with love.
itemdesc-acornmuffin-cooked: A fluffy and delicious acorn berry muffin!
itemdesc-acornmuffin-dough: Soft acorn berry dough. Handle with love.
itemdesc-dumpling-raw: Hearty, filling dumplings. Good in meals.
itemdesc-acorndumpling-raw: Hearty, filling dumplings with an earthy flavor. Good in meals.
itemdesc-acorndumpling-cooked: Hearty, filling dumplings with an earthy flavor.
itemdesc-soysauce: Savory soy sauce, good in stews or on sushi!
itemdesc-driedseaweed: Used with raw fish and rice to make sushi.
itemdesc-sushi-noveggie-nooil: A naked sushi roll. Come on, spice it up!
itemdesc-sushi-*-oil: The best sushi roll imaginable. Heavenly!
itemdesc-sushi-noveggie-honey: A sushi roll drizzled with honey. Sweet!
itemdesc-sushi-*-honey: The best sushi roll imaginable. Heavenly!
itemdesc-sushiveg-noveggie-nooil: A naked sushi roll. Come on, spice it up!
itemdesc-sushiveg-*-oil: The best sushi roll imaginable. Heavenly!
itemdesc-sushiveg-noveggie-honey: A sushi roll drizzled with honey. Sweet!
itemdesc-sushiveg-*-honey: The best sushi roll imaginable. Heavenly!
itemdesc-sausage-*-raw: Hang it up to dry or cook it fast!
itemdesc-sausageherb-*-raw: Hang it up to dry or cook it fast!
itemdesc-sausageherb-*-cooked: Juicy and delicious, bursting with flavor!
itemdesc-sausageherb-*-driedcooked: You've never had meat so tasty!
itemdesc-sausagefish-*-raw: Hang it up to dry or cook it fast!
itemdesc-sausagefishherb-*-raw: Hang it up to dry or cook it fast!
itemdesc-sausagefishherb-*-cooked: Juicy and delicious, bursting with flavor!
itemdesc-sausagefishherb-*-driedcooked: You've never had meat so tasty!
itemdesc-birchsapportion: Boil into syrup or drink it on its own!
itemdesc-maplesapportion: This would make some great syrup...
itemdesc-foodoilportion-*: Great for cooking or lubricating mechanics!
itemdesc-fruitjuiceportion-*: Put into a barrel or bottle to start fermenting!
itemdesc-fruitwineportion-*: Put into a barrel or bottle to start fermenting!
itemdesc-soysauce: Umami! Good in almost any meal.
itemdesc-fishsauce: Umami! Good in almost any meal.
itemdesc-treesyrupportion-*: Thick, sweet, good on treats or as batter!
itemdesc-brothportion-bone: Yummy bone juice that thickens stews and soups right up!
itemdesc-agedmeat-*-normal: Slice off the outside to get to the good part!
itemdesc-agedmeat-*-cut: Dry aged meat, tender and delicious.
itemdesc-agedmeat-*-tender: It falls apart at the touch!
itemdesc-agedmeat-*-meatball: It falls apart at the touch!
itemdesc-gelatin-liquid: Congealed bone juice. Cook it with bones to solidify it more.
itemdesc-gelatin-raw: Mostly solid gelatin that should be cooked with water and other liquids.
itemdesc-lard: A good replacement for fat or food oil.
itemdesc-breadedball-*-cooked: A crunchy, delicious fried ball of... something!
itemdesc-breadedvegetable-*-cooked: A fried vegetable. Soft on the inside!
itemdesc-pasteurizedmilkportion: Boiled milk. Mix with a yogurt starter.
itemdesc-yogurt-starter: Sour curds. Mix with pasteurized milk.
itemdesc-yogurt-ferment: Seal in a bottle or barrel to turn into edible yogurt.
itemdesc-gozinakiherb-*: A fantastically nutty dessert, with fragrant undertones.
itemdesc-softresin: Needs 0.7-1.0 L and 2 months to cure into resin.
itemdesc-tea-herb: A healthy drink that soothes the spirit.
itemdesc-herbalbread-dough: Dough that's been infused with delicious herbs.
itemdesc-herbalbread-cooked: Fragrant. Best when shared with others.
itemdesc-herbalacornbread-dough: Nutty dough that's been infused with delicious herbs.
itemdesc-herbalacornbread-cooked: Fragrant and nutty. Best when shared with others.
itemdesc-herbalacornbread-bread: Fragrant, nutty bread drizzled with syrup.
